If you haven't already, you will need to: 如果你还没有准备好，你将会需要从我们的主页上下载 elementary OS。你需要拷贝已下载的ISO文件到一个USB闪存驱动器上，以使用安装说明书安装系统。
elementary OS is currently built for two: elementary OS 适用于两种处理器架构，32位或者64位。
If you know you have a newer computer wi: 如果您了解您拥有一台64位处理器的计算机，请选择64位版本。
If your computer is older or you do not: 如果您的计算机较老或您不知道处理器的版本，请选择32位的版本。(64位处理器可以兼容此版本)。
Intel i3 or comparable dual-core 64-bit: 英特尔i3 或 类似的双核64位处理器
Make sure to back your important data up: 确保您已备份重要数据至其他位置例如云存储或其他硬盘。安装一个新的操作系统将会清除现有数据。
Choose your current Operating System: 选择您现在的操作系统
Select the operating system you are curr: 选择您现在使用的操作系统来查看安装说明。
Verifying your download is an important,: 确认下载是一个重要但非必要的步骤。我们为elementary OS的镜像生成了校验码(或者hash值)，我们建议您在安装前确认您下载的文件校验码是否正确。这可以确保您收到的是完好的、下载完整、未损坏的镜像。
Windows doesn't include a built-in tool: Windows 没有包含一个内置工具来校验SHA256，如果有需要您可以点此下载 哈希工具。
Under &quot;Input File&quot; select <cod: 在 "Input File"上选择 Select File(s) 并且找到 elementary OS的 ISO 文件。
Verify that the text in &quot;Results&qu: 用下列哈希值与在Results中的文本进行校验匹配。
Creating an Install Drive: 创建一个 安装驱动器
Rufus - select ISO: Rufus - 选取 ISO 文件
You'll need a USB flash drive with at le: You'll need a USB flash drive with at least 1 GB of free space and a program called Rufus.
Insert your USB drive and select it in t: Insert your USB drive and select it in the "Device" list
Select &quot;ISO Image&quot; next to &qu: Select "ISO Image" next to "Create a bootable disk using..."
to choose the ISO that you downloaded pr: 来选择您在前面下载的ISO文件。
Click &quot;Start&quot; and wait for the: Click "Start" and wait for the process to finish.
Booting from the Install Drive: 从“安装驱动器（即安装光盘或USB驱动器）”中引导
In order to start the installation proce: 为了执行安装向导，您需要使您的计算机的引导模式为“安装驱动器（例如USB驱动器或安装光盘）”优先。
Assuming that your computer is still on,: 假设你的电脑还在运行，先插入你的安装光盘或可移动存储设备，然后重启你的电脑。
Most computers will briefly allow you to: 大多数计算机允许你通过一个特殊按键简要的修改引导顺序，一般为<kbd>F12</kbd>，但是有时候是<kbd>Esc</kbd>或其他功能键。通过阅读计算机的说明书或观察计算机开机时的右下角屏幕来确定您应该使用的按键。
Press <kbd>F12</kbd> (or the appropriate: Press <kbd>F12</kbd> (or the appropriate key) and select the install drive—usually "USB-HDD" or something containing the word "USB", but the wording may vary. If you choose the incorrect drive, your computer will likely continue to boot as normal. Just restart your computer and pick a different drive in that menu.
Shortly after selecting the appropriate: Shortly after selecting the appropriate boot drive, you should be presented with the elementary OS splash screen. You may now follow the on-screen instructions which will guide you through the rest of the process.
Running the following command in your te: Running the following command in your terminal:
Before creating an install drive, make s: Before creating an install drive, make sure you have all OS X updates installed. To check for available updates, open the Apple Menu and select either "Software Update…" or "App Store…" Make sure to install any OS updates in addition to ones labeled with "Firmware" and "Boot Camp".
You'll need a USB flash drive with at le: You'll need a USB flash drive with at least 1 GB of free space and a program called "Create elementary Installer".
Open &quot;Create elementary Installer&q: Open "Create elementary Installer". If your Mac cannot open it because it's from an unidentifiable developer, right click the app, and select "Open".
Insert the spare USB drive, and select t: Insert the spare USB drive, and select the ISO file you've just downloaded.
Create elementary OS USB Installer: 创建 elementart OS USB安装优盘
Select your USB drive to start the insta: Select your USB drive to start the installer creation process.
If your Mac doesn't recognize the result: If your Mac doesn't recognize the resulting drive in the boot menu, you may need to create an elementary OS Install DVD instead. To create one, insert a blank DVD, right click on the ISO file in Finder, and select "Burn elementaryos-freya-xx.xx.iso to Disc".
After you hear the chime, press and hold: After you hear the chime, press and hold <kbd>Option</kbd>. Then, select the appropriate boot drive. Note that it may be incorrectly identified as "Windows", but this is normal.
You'll need a USB flash drive with at le: You'll need a USB flash drive with at least 1 GB of free space and a program called UNetbootin.
Open UNetbootin from the Dash. It will o: Open UNetbootin from the Dash. It will open a window like the one below:
Click &quot;…&quot; to select the ISO th: Click "…" to select the ISO that you downloaded previously.
Unplug all USB memory devices apart from: Unplug all USB memory devices apart from the one you want to use.
Click &quot;OK&quot; and wait for the pr: Click "OK" and wait for the process to finish.
Take this time to read the <a href=\"/do: Take this time to read the getting started guide to learn about your new operating system.
